Rubidium (Rb)

Description

Rubidium is one of the more reactive alkali metals, and thus its use outside laboratory research. It was discovered in 1861 by Gustav Kirchhoff and Robert Bunsen. Rubidium is the 25th most common element to consist on Earth.

Atomic Diagram

Atomic Number

37

Atomic Mass

85.468

Melting point

180℃

Boiling Point

39.30℃

Group

1

Period

5
